Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Accommodation in London”
Reviews.Author: krandolph1818
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed two night at this hotel on the 27th & 28th of February. We paid 80 USD a night (40 each because we split it) which was the same price we were considering paying for a hostel... so glad I chose here instead! Even though our room had not been refurbished yet (53) you could tell that the rest of the hotel had been/was going through refurbishment. It looked beautiful! When I booked I made sure breakfast was included, but I assumed that it would be cold, continental... boy was I surprised! The breakfast was made to order and you could chose eggs, bacon, sausage (etc.) or even a full English breakfast! The absolute best thing about this hotel is the location, less than 5 minutes to Paddington which connects to the major tube lines for attractions around London, and the neighborhood it is in felt very safe (even for two young women traveling alone). The pub close by had great food and great beer and the locals in the area as well as hotel staff were very friendly and didn't mind answering a few tourist questions. In fact, most people went out of their way to give us a hand and friendly advice. I look forward to my next trip to London and my next stay at the Hotel Athena.

Reviews.Title: “What do people want?”
Reviews.Author: stu m
Reviews.Content: Myself & my girlfriend stopped here for 2 nights on the 27th January 2012, and for £75 a night bed & breakfast it was very reasonable. The hotel looks like it's had a makeover at some point, but the finishing off leaves a lot to be desired, but for the price you pay it's relatively clean and presentable, yes the rooms are small but show me any hotel in London below a 4 star that isn't. The hotel is on Sussex Gardens which is about a 5 minute walk to Paddington tube station so is very well located in that sense. The staff are not English but that's fine by me and were very polite and even allowed us to leave our bags in reception for 6 hours after check in. Don't hesitate to book here if it's a room you're after to sightsee, we just used the hotel for somewhere to sleep and eat breakfast which for us was spot on! All in all, very good for the price - If i had to make one minor comment it would be on the size of the English breakfast, it is quite small but they do offer cereals, toast and fruit salad as well so you can fill up. My overall advice would be to book :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in there with my family in may while on a holiday, overall we thought the athena hotel was alright. Our room was a tad small but we were mainly out looking at the magnificent sights of London. Pretty good location, near a few things like hyde park, madame tussuads, Abby road, and a few more :) had a few nice resturuants around. and when we were there they were re-painting most of this hotel and it smelt fairly bad. but i was pleased with the included breakfast. it was pretty good, hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: T011
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible stay there! The staff can be very rude, especially those who serve breakfast in the morning. The room was very dusty, the curtains looked as though they've never been cleaned since they've been put up and the bed covers looked so terrible! Furthermore, some of the amenities in the room were not working. I will never stay there again! There are many hotels next to this one that seemed much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: Geirolav01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my second visit. The hotel had been reurbished during last year and the room was nice and modern but rather small. We had ordered a twin bed room but got a double:-(( Breakfast was nice this time also.

Reviews.Title: “LEFT QUICKLY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 189473Chris
Reviews.Content: After tthe check in we went to the room and we dediced to leave the next morning. The room was small, not clean enough, broken utilities in the room, seemed and felt very old and in need of a major renovation. VERY DISSAPOINTED. The next morning we went to another hotel cloese to Athena Hotel and we were very satisfied...

Reviews.Title: “Had read the reviews prior to arriving and was pleasantly surprised upon checking-in”
Reviews.Author: Flip_switch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few blocks from Paddington Station and about a 15-20 minute walk to Oxford st. The hotel seems to have undergone renovations. The room we were in was very roomy with high ceilings and clean. The beds were comfortable. There was a towel warmer in the bathroom which was quite handy. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic. Yes there are a few of the girls who don't speak too much English as others have commented but the majority there do speak it very well. Everyone is quite friendly and the breakfast was wonderful way to start off the day. The dinning room is also quite spacious. If you do intend to pay with credit card, there is that 5% transaction fee. I'd read the reviews prior to arriving at the hotel and it was noted in my reservation as well. I simply withdrew the necessarily amount in order to pay in cash upon arrival. The transaction fee for withdrawing from my bank while overseas was much cheaper than the added 5%. The front desk attendants are nice. They were helpful in answering our questions and arranging airport transportation. Overall, I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Skipper80
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the location as it was close to both Oxford Street for shopping and Hyde park as we were going to some gigs there. The size of our room was a bit disappointing as there were 3 of us so I booked a triple room but this was more like a double room with a double bed and single bed in it. So 2 of us had to share which was OK but not what was expected and with all of our luggage and shopping the room was pretty cluttered. The hairdryer in the room didn't work which was a concern but they did have a spare at reception so calm was restored. There are a few parking spaces outside the entrance of the hotel but I wouldn't bank on one being free. There is an underground carpark up the road which is not cheap but is probably the most reasonable in the area. You can park on the single yellows at certain times and there is a church carpark up the road but you need to book in advance so may be an idea to contact the hotel first regarding this.. failing that you are very close to tube stations so just don't drive! Some of the decor in the hotel looked a bit half done, there were exposed wires in the hallway! Breakfast was OK, the usual sort of 'full' english stuff. I would stay here again if only for the location but next time I would phone ahead to ensure that I had the right size room for my group.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, over-priced room--with an additional surcharge for using credit cards!”
Reviews.Author: Dalry
Reviews.Content: Our so-called 'double' room was tiny and inconvenient--no room to move, with about 12 inches clearance on each side of the bed. One person had to stay on the bed if the other wanted to move! It looked like a dorm room. The bathroom wasn't much better: sitting on the toilet meant your knees were in the shower, the only toiletries provided were two tiny bars of soap--never replenished. Public areas were shabby and not very clean. Though I had booked this location based on a rate of 95 pounds a night quoted by booking.com. I did not--in the end--receive that rate.When I queried it, booking.com asked if I had a screen capture to prove that was the rate quoted--who does that? The hotel did not help to explain the discrepancy either. Instead, I paid 140 for three of the four nights, with a total bill of 485 pounds. At the original quoted rate this hotel would have been bearable, but one can find much better accommodation--even in London--for 140 pounds a night. Overall extraordinarily disappointed and will not stay here or use booking.com again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, simple room at a good value in London”
Reviews.Author: Bedina
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I shared the family room, which was quite small but clean an with a recently re-modelled bathroom. Breakfast was full English (not just muffins) and staff was friendly. The hotel looked to be freshly painted, and was neat and clean with good daily room service. My companions did think the mattresses could have been better (or just needed to be flipped), although I slept well. Payment with a credit card has an additional fee, and we were asked for payment in advance (I should also note that we didn't have the full amount upon arrival, and staff was willing and cheerful about letting us wait a day so that we could hit an ATM). The hotel is two-ish long blocks from Paddington Station, in a neighborhood with many other hotels. Internet access has an additional fee, but right around the corner is Intercoffee, with free WiFi and excellent lattes. If you're looking for a huge family room, this is not it. If you're looking for British-B&B charm, expect to pay 3x as much and in a different neighborhood. We wanted safe, clean, reasonably-priced, and near an Underground station, which is exactly what we got. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money baring in mind that you are in central london”
Reviews.Author: amadorak
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff. the rooms are not very big but they are clean. very good for a short weekend very good location, 3-5 min walk from tube.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Racerx51
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very good value. Staff was very helpful with question I had and giving good directions. Breakfast was very good and timely. Room was clean and nice bathroom. All you could expect and more for a value priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Halleluja-moment”
Reviews.Author: Locisen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel thinking this would be a dump (concidering the price of Â£620 for 5 people for 4 nights). But we were astonished. The hotel had recently gone through a renovation so the pictures from a few of the reviewers are out of date. The rooms could be updated to the same standard as the lobby and the breakfast room, but I assume they will be updated aswell. We were very satisfied with our stay here, and will definetly come back! (I stayed in room 24, my perception of the rooms are based on this room)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, property being renovated”
Reviews.Author: RagazzaDaRoma
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for money hotel, especially for single travellers looking for everything they may need in terms of basics (lift, wifi and breakfast) included in a reasobable price. The hotel was undergoing some great renovations while I was there an on my last day (yesterday 5 feb) they had nearly finished the reception area which will be brand new. I had an upgrade from a single room to a double which was quite small so fine for one person as it was a small double but good for the single traveller as i said. couples may want to check on the size of their bed and rooms as bigger rooms may be available. the breakfast offered in the room stay (which not all hotels offer by the way) was more than adequate and nice. The hotel staff were extremely helpful with everything often helping me to bring too many bags upstairs after shopping trips and helped to answer all my questions. very good overall value for money here which is not that easy to find. the hotel is 5 mins walk from Paddington and 10 mins walk to Lancaster Gate for the red central line. they charge 5% extra for payment with credit card

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: Geirolav01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights since my regular hotel in the area was full. Ok hotel and rooms. English breakfast included was also OK.

Reviews.Title: “Falty Towers”
Reviews.Author: MattNZKiwi
Reviews.Content: It didn't even start well. The guy behind the desk acted like he hadn't slept for the last 3 days. He looked about as happy to see another customer as a mouse looks after a failed attempt at removing the cheese from the trap. The 'modern' card key to open the door to our room didn't work, so back down to reception I went. But instead of getting a new card, I was told to go back up and try a 'trick' they knew of (obviously this happens often). He didn't even get off his seat from the reception and come and show me this 'trick'. Well after trying this 'trick' 15 times the door opened. To be fair after the 4th day I was getting pretty good at breaking into our room each night. The room ,especially the bathroom, needed some seriously big renovations. The bathroom tiles were cracked and the grouting between them was so old it was breaking up. Something was once attached to the bathroom wall now broken off but the rusty old mark was still there. The sink was blocked and the shower water preassure was one minute ok, the next minute no water came out and then it did but it was cold. The breakfast was pathetic and it was like musicalÂ´chairs at times to get out of the breakfast area. The good news was I slept ok . ultimately we were glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Never been bumped from a room before”
Reviews.Author: hsc_ky
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room about a month before our trip to London. We were 3 adults and 1 kids, thus they quoted an extra charge for the child and we agreed upon that. We reached london and called them asking for directions etc. There was no indication of a problem till then. We walked all the way from Paddington station to the hotel and upon finally reaching it, they told us that the room was no longer available and they had switched our reservation to a sister concern "Hotel Haven" (far from it) which was just down the road. It turned out to be a 5 blocks away and we struggled up to t\hat one. If they had told us that they didnt have a room before, we would have take a cab. I dont know that the game was, but they over book and try to bump people off to this shanty hotel. It would still have been ok if the alternate room was good. We were stuck into a basement room with no ventilation, dirty bathrooms, indifferent staff. Certainly a life experience. Pay the extra money and book in a better place. All these 3rd grade hotels are not worth it, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: leonardcohen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and for a budget hotel I think this was extremely good value. It averaged at Â£32 per person in a room for three. Even though the decor is a bit tired and dated the room (no. 32 ) was extremely clean, lots of towels and soap, extra blankets, pillows, teabags and coffee sachets. The receptionist was very pleasant and helpful as was the lady serving in the breakfast room. For the price we paid I am very satisfied with the hotel and service. Excellent location, near Paddington tube with lots of places to eat. Remember this is a very cheap priced hotel for London before you make comments.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the worst place I have ever stayed..”
Reviews.Author: Missaki
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start from..Horrible, tiny and old room. The mattress was disgusting, the pilows too, we had to sleep in our clothes because we felt we wer going to get bed bags, carpet dirty full of hair, the shower was awful and there was water all over the place. Breakfast was ok but I didn't feel like touching anything cooked in that establishment and the waiter couldn't really speak a word of English making her very rude. The owners haven't spent a penny renovating the place, all the care about I guess is to make money without providing anything in return..Honestly not worth 65 Euros..25 maybe..Stay Away..

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Leoniecat
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget when we booked this and, after reading the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, we thought we'd give it a go. I can't say I was that impressed with the hotel but as we only paid Â£79 per room with breakfast, we didn't expect much. The positives were that the reception staff were friendly, the breakfast wasn't bad and there was hot water in the ensuite. Unfortunately, that's where the positives end. We paid for a double room, but only got a 3/4 width bed in a VERY small room. The drawers in the desk didn't fit properly and when we managed to open one, it was filthy inside so wouldn't have put anything in there. The heated towel rail in the ensuite didn't work so it was freezing in there. The shower curtain was filthy. There were stains on the bed cover. The plumbing in the bedroom upstairs was really noisy. When the person upstairs walked around their room there was a bizarre plastic squeaking sound. All in all, we don't rate the hotel very highly. But, if you are on a budget and only stopping for one night it would do. Personally, we'd never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: PAPADONCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving in London, my wife and I booked online a hotel (around the corner) and had a terrible experiece. We knew we would be returning to London the next week so we stopped in at the Athena to inquire about a room for the return. The staff was pleasant and showed us a room. We could see the building, though old, was maintained with a level of pride (clean rooms and everything worked). For a more thorough review, read Mr Sadiq Lakhani's, January 1, 2009 write-up. I feel this is an accurate portrayal of what we found. I would like to "ditto" his comments. Thank you Athena for helping my wife and I regroup on accomodations during our stay in London. Don Kudrna, California

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: musicmadwomen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5.30 paid the full amount for the 2 rooms we booked, went upstairs see our rooms and god they are bad, our room was meant tobe a 3 bedded Non smoking room, we arrived and a ash tray and a cigerette buts were all outside, the room smelt damp, but as so hot we went and had a bath, there were no towels when we got out, so my husband went and asked for some, to be told the laundry had not arrived today, (saturday) meaning no towels and the beds were not changed, the other rooom, which was a double had a single bed in it, and one small towel, the bed was also stained. we complained and wanted to leave with full refund, But No they charged us Â£100.00 for taking a bath, and we are still waiting for the?Â£160.00 extra we paid. Never again, the place should be shut down discusting.

Reviews.Title: “..Most Amazing Experience!!! highly recommeded ...”
Reviews.Author: Sadiq_Lakhani
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED!! I booked this hotel from the internet for a one night stay prior to arrival online by Credit card. Reading your reviews had me scared, the website of the hotel showed all facilities i wanted. But your reviews were so bad... So I just booked online by credit card for only one night. In case it turned out to be like you said I would run away the next day. I arrived last night, however I called the booking agent and took the hotel direct number and called the hotel in the morning to please give me good room as I have heard scary review about it. I tell you its not true at all, I assume probably it could be other nearby hotel people killing competition... who knows, it just takes a few lines to kill business. But really dont go "too much" on reviews, call personally and take name of the person at the desk so you can later tell them how your room was. Ok... review....Its an amazing hotel , excellent location, great service, has lift to the rooms, not drag bags to 4th floors and losr 5 lbs. Internet wireless for Â£ 7 a day 24 hours if you have laptop. Does not feel like a BB at all, but like a proper hotel, if you wait and book just one or two days before you come you have a chance to get amazing rates.... There is good coffee tea making in the room. The decor, fixtures, lights, plugs, and the design of room is just right... There is attention to detail, and the heating is superb , its -6 degrees nowadays here.... brrrr..... Jan 09. The TV is nice, new wall mounted, and washroom were clean and impeccable, and I must say its an amazing room, in the price , Jan 2009 price Â£ 40 from the internet. Sussex Gardens location is great too , close to Hyde park and close to Edgware Road too with budget restaurants and internet cafes open till late at night. Buses and tube real close. In London Sussex gardens is a great area to stay in, so close to Marble Arch, and Oxford Street for you crazy shoppers, just a few minutes pop down on any bus going down Edgware road. I love London and I love this hotel and by the way no one is paying me to write this. I am also , like most of you an avid traveler and a budding travel writer, I travel mostly in SE Asia, Thailand and around. London after many years now. So give it a shot, if you coming to London, call them from before, not the agents, take the number of the hotel from the agent and call personally and ask for a good room. And you are made. Try for one night if in doubt, and if you don't like it there are so many BBs all lined up on Sussex gardens, more than 50 I assume, so you can move.the next day too. Happy traveling.... thank you Athena!!! Sadiq Lakhani A Banker , Adventure traveler, IT professional. Wannabe Travel Writer.... sadiq.lakhani@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “They let themselves down”
Reviews.Author: KatTamworth
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2.30pm to find our room was not ready. They had 'lost' the housekeeping keys and wanted us to depart without our room keys, leaving our possesions behind. We got back around 10.30pm to find we couldn't get to our room the way we'd been shown as there was a wedding going on. We were told to go outside and enter through another door which we did not know about. The plumber then showed us right around the building to a completely separate entrance we had not been informed of. Thankfully when we got back to the hotel there was still someone around or we would never have known how to get in. The shower did not work properly. Breakfast was late and was only toast and tea. I had advised of my daughter having a gluten intolerance but there was no acknowledgement of this made. The road noise kept me awake most of the night too. The room was adequate and cheap - we could have enjoyed our stay had the staff been more organised. I really feel that the previous reviews of people going the extra mile and being willing to help gave me a high expectation of customer service that was just not there. I was really disappointed with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: antmara
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to London , I have to say , this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms smelt fusty and were dirty. There were dirty stains up the wallpaper and on the outer bedding. Sash Windows did not fully close , heating did not work. Very noisy and cold all night. We complained to staff about the rooms, we were shown an alternate room which was just as bad. They offered to move us accross the road - after a phone call this was not possible. When we checked out in the morning the night porter was asleep, we had to wake him to aks for a receipt. No receipts available - provided postage address - still waiting .. Full of tradesmen - not suitable for families or anyone else. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone-

Reviews.Title: “Clean but decor looking tired”
Reviews.Author: AllSquare
Reviews.Content: Made unexpected arrival at reception, we were only staying for one night and wanted to drop our overnight bags, whilst we went out for lunch then on to the theatre. The receptionist made us very welcome and checked on availability, the room was ready so we checked in immediately. We paid Â£99 for the room which we thought reasonable for London. Yes the decor was a little tired, there was no chair to sit on had we wanted to or bath and washbasin plugs so SHOWER or SHOWER was the order of the day. The staff were very pleasant and a tasty English breakfast made and served to order.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: wmger
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night and paid 150 pound! The room was in the basement - not very clean. The lady at the reception terrible. I had the feeling that she felt disturbed in reading her book. The breakfast was horrible. We then changed the hotel and got a much better one for 71 pound. THIS "Athena Hotel" is not a hotel! It is more or less a dosshouse (but a very expensive one)l Through your money out of the window and you have much jmore than staying at this place. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cablo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Athena hotel for 5 nights in a family room at a very reasonable rate. We were more than happy with this nice, clean hotel. The breakfast was very good (English breakfast) and was included in the price of the room. The staff were very kind and helpful. This hotel is located in Sussex Gardens, a pleasant avenue lined with London plane trees (Platanus acerifolia) not far from Hyde Park, close to Edgware Road and Paddington tube stations so from here you can easily go anywhere in London. Restaurants, convenience stores and internet facilities are also within easy reach, just round the corner towards Paddington station (Praed Street, London Street). I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DublinSymi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Athena hotel for 4 nights. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, any requests we had were dealt with speedily . The breakfast each morning was very good (english breakfast) and was included in the price of the room. The hotel itself is located close to Edgeware Road and Paddington tube stations so its easy to get to and from there from anywhere in London. The hotel is also around the corner from a rather fine Indian restaurant, the Ryath, if you fancy a lovely meal. My only gripe about the hotel would be the decor (needs a makeover) but if all you need is somewhere to put your head down at night, and a good breakfast then you cant go wrong here. Louise, Dublin, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “what do you expect”
Reviews.Author: tsny2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Athena for 3 nights, I booked the hotel over the web and after booking it read a couple of reviews ( I know wrong way round)and started to panic at what people had written and was dreading arriving there. For what we paid I didn't expect the Ritz, but the room was clean and tidy,plenty of hot water,staff were friendly and helpful you get what you pay for. I remember reading a reviews about the Marriott Marquis (5 star) in New York were we stayed last year and that was all negative, the hotel was fantastic in every way so you can not always go by reviews wriiten you have to try these hotels yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelalot
Reviews.Content: We had actually booked the Gower Hotel opposite, but on arrival we were sent to the Athena Hotel by the unfriendly receptionist, without explanation. She assured us the Athena was actually three stars instead of the Gower's two. Having seen the inside of the Gower, we were only too happy to go! So to the Athena we went, where we were greeted by another monosyllabic receptionist and given the key to Room 15. I know we were only paying Â£55 but we expected the room to be clean and it wasnâ€™t. I have attached some photos which really donâ€™t do it justice, it was much worse than it looks! The carpet was absolutely filthy, and had dark grey 15" wide border of dirt around the skirting board, which blended nicely with the paint blobs and unidentifiable stains the rest of it was patterned with.... The wallpaper was peeling off the walls and the net curtains looked as thought they had never been washed, and were the same dark grey as the carpet! The bed was pushed right up against the window so we had to tie the nets in a knot to stop them falling over us in the night. The bedding was actually surprisingly clean considering the rest of the room, it was just a shame the sheets had holes in them! The bathroom however, was fairly clean although the toilet had brown stains in it. We would have complained but the surly receptionist had disappeared when we went back downstairs, and to be honest from the state of the place I'm not sure they would have had anything better anyway. When we went down for breakfast in the morning we were studiously ignored by both the serving staff for about 5 minutes until we managed to corner one of them and ask where we were supposed to sit. The breakfast was ok, no complaints for the money but they didnâ€™t come back to see if we wanted tea or coffee. So a hugely disappointing experience and we were always prepared for a very basic room because of the cost but not the dirt or staff attitude. There was no 3 star rating signage anywhere on view in the Athena nor did the Gower across the road display their supposed two star rating. We have friends who run a a three star hotel and they would have their rating taken away if they had the nerve to give customers a room like this!

HotelInfo.Name: Athena Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 110-114 Sussex Gardens | Paddington, London W2 1UA, England
